utterance.content: Because you crashed my workout?

utterance.content: You're doing core training. Which improves balance, which staves off the most debilitating symptoms of Huntington's. You've ended your self-destructive streak. utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: And my first choice is the community health clinic I interviewed with yesterday.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Absolutely, you should do that. Three hours a week. Every doctor should 'cause every doctor can. But you don't want to be every doctor. Plus, on my team, you get to screw with Foreman. Every way but literally.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Why are you doing it this way? You're pretending to assume we're all coming back without actually asking us. Why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: See, this is why you'd be miserable wiping noses in a clinic.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You can't ask because you can't face the rejection. Why not? What's going on?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Are you asking me to ask you?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm saying you shouldn't, for your sake as well as mine.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We don't know how much the sclerosing cholangitis has damaged your liver. It might be in a year, it might be in ten. But the odds are you're gonna need a new one. And you should know, while no transplant committee will say this openly, they'll never grant an organ to someone working in your profession.

utterance.speaker: Hank
utterance.content: You're saying I have to change jobs? You're medically advising me to change jobs.

utterance.speaker: Lexa
utterance.content: Hank, if you're too sick –

utterance.speaker: Hank
utterance.content: She wants me to have some kind of religious conversion. She's practically salivating over it.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I'm just being candid about –

utterance.speaker: Hank
utterance.content: So you don't think I’m scum. Just some committee thinks I’m scum.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: That your lifestyle has risks.

utterance.speaker: Hank
utterance.content: You work around more sick people and germs and blood than I do. I’m not gonna live my life afraid like my parents did. Barely letting me play outside and God forbid that I get a scratch.

utterance.speaker: Lexa
utterance.content: I'll talk to him. He'll calm down and realize that this is the only –

utterance.speaker: Hank
utterance.content: No. No, I won't. Why does everyone want to dictate the way I live my life?

utterance.speaker: Lexa
utterance.content: Because the way we're living is gonna kill you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Passing the pancreatic duct...

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Don't listen to House.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You have no idea what he said.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I know that House is manipulative. I know that you're in a vulnerable state right now, and I know that Cameron wants your marriage to work. So do you. So don't listen to House.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House doesn't make my decisions. We're in the common bile duct.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What's that mass? Gallstone?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Can we magnify times five? That's not a gallstone.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: His liver's completely filled with worms.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You have strongyloides, also known as threadworms. They disseminated all over your body, causing all your symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Hank
utterance.content: How'd I get a parasite?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Most likely through sexual activity, but we can't be sure.

utterance.speaker: Lexa
utterance.content: And… w-what's the treatment?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Two mebendazole pills.

utterance.speaker: Hank
utterance.content: That's it?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You'll be fine. Your liver too. Go back to your lives.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You know this is the doctors’ lounge.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: I know. It seemed like the place to read doctors' notes. You are good at it, by the way.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why are you reading my charts?

utterance.content: Because I’m worried about my girlfriend.

utterance.content: Your girlfriend... is a male porn star?

utterance.content: Oh, no, I’m dating Lisa Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Cool, huh? And if House doesn't have his team, that'll make her miserable, which will make me miserable. Which brings us to the fact that you have elevated noting to an art form.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I see the connection.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Most doctors write "9:00 a.m." if they scrub in at 9:00 or anything near it. You write 9:03, and you make little notations when procedures are delayed.

utterance.content: You're easily impressed.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Well, yeah. I was, till I saw that you had virtually stopped writing them about four weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Been busy. Got a backlog.

utterance.content: Yeah... People with your level of precision don't really just "get" backlogs. No one knows why you're leaving PPTH.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Because it's personal.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Well, if something happened, I mean, if you're leaving to get away from something that you did, or she did, or both of you did. utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Thanks for the folksy wisdom.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Hey, you got any, uh, dirt on any of the other three? It'd really help me out.

utterance.content: I thought you said those two pills was all he needed!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Lungs are filling with fluid.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Suction him and get him on oxygen.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Patient's lungs are severely compromised. Liver's still failing.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Worms could easily have been a coincidence. Almost be surprising if he didn't have 'em.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Which means it could be a hematological problem plus cardiomyopathy.

utterance.content: No, neck veins are flat, precordial exam was normal.

utterance.content: What if it's lymphoma? Peritoneal carcinomatosis explains the liver failure. Paraneoplastic syndrome explains everything else.

utterance.content: Lymphoma it is. Prep him for chemo. Fax Taub and Thirteen the latest update on the case.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They have as much right to know as anyone on the team.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You either like the diagnosis or you don't. If you don't, we need to keep talking. If you do, you need to shut up. What we don't need is this stupid game.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're mad at House, but you're not mad at me.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Do you want me to be mad at you?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You blame House. Not me.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I am mad at House because he's an ass. And I am mad at you, but I don't want to leave you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What I did may be the worst thing I ever did. It may be the best. I'm either a murderer or a guy who stopped a mass murderer, but I did it. Me. And even if it destroys me, I’d do it again today.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You don't mean that. This isn't you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm not running away from what I did because you want to pretend I never did it.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: If that's how you feel... Okay.

utterance.content: My strategy's not completely working. All four of them want to work for me, but all four of them have reasons why they don't want to work for me. utterance.content: The answer has nothing to do with the question.

utterance.content: Then it's not technically the answer.

utterance.content: Why do you need three of these doctors?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because I know they're good. Other doctors fall into the "might be good" category.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It has nothing to do with them being good. You think they're idiots half the time, but they're comfortable. You feel abandoned by Cuddy, so you're reaching out to people you know for comfort.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, my God, you're right. I don't need doctors at all. I just need a good friend.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Cuddy's right. Maybe, just maybe, if I don't play along, you'll realize you can't solve a deeper problem with a surface solution.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Would've been more profound if you hadn't said anything.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Getting through it.

utterance.content: Be a lot easier once you two are away from here.

utterance.content: Yeah. He's peeing blood. BP's rising.

utterance.content: Heart rate's up to 250. He's going into cardiac arrest.

utterance.content: He's bleeding out.

utterance.content: His body's completely giving out. Charging. clear.

utterance.content: We've got him stabilized, but no red cells, no white cells, practically no platelets either.

utterance.content: Mebendazole can cause adverse effects, but nothing like this.

utterance.content: He's been off 'em since yesterday, anyway.

utterance.content: Long passes, wild guesses, anything.

utterance.content: Hypopituitarism. Could cause multi-organ failure if –

utterance.content: If his thyroid hormone wasn't completely normal.

utterance.content: Renal cell carcinoma.

utterance.content: Renal ultrasound was clean.

utterance.content: I'd say aleukemic leukemia. Marrow's not making enough normal cells –

utterance.content: You want to nuke the patient's marrow? He had no evidence of being anemic or immune-compromised when he was admitted.

utterance.content: Ablation could kill him or leave him defenseless against an infection that could.

utterance.content: The risks are, uh, they're really minimal. We'll do a series of painless injections, and – Excuse me. The whole thing can be done as an outpatient.

utterance.content: You're leaving at 11:00 a.m.?

utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.content: The worms weren't hurting him. They were helping him. He has extraintestinal Crohn's. He got it from being raised in a too clean, too overprotective of an environment.

utterance.content: So his life of filth wasn't the problem. Clean living was. Let's start him on methylprednisolone.

utterance.content: And some helminths.

utterance.content: Worms. Cool, huh? Best out of three?

utterance.content: I want to be on the team.

utterance.content: Thanks for the sarcasm. I reorganized my life to spend more time with her, but apparently I don't love her as much as I thought.

utterance.content: I told House I want to work for him again. Stay on the team. You were always more into it than I was, more interested in diagnostics. Unless House was right about why you want out.

utterance.content: Four for four.

utterance.content: I was in love with you. I was an idiot. Tried to be like you, tried to understand you because I thought I could heal you. You almost killed that patient.

utterance.content: Any idea where I can get a great, big "Mission Accomplished" banner? Got my sanity back, my license back, and now...
